targets.expr: label_replace( sum(mongodb_up{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"}) by ( group_id, org_id, rs_nm, cl_name), "hostname", "$1", "instance", "(.*)")

label_replace( sum(mongodb_info{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"}) by (instance, replica_state_name, process_port, rs_nm, process_type), "hostname", "$1", "instance", "(.*):.*")

panels.description: The number of kilobytes of used shared memory (shared between several processes, thus including RAM disks, SYS-V-IPC and BSD like SHMEM)
panels.title: System Memory - Shared

panels.description: The number of kilobytes of buffer cache, relatively temporary storage for raw disk blocks
panels.title: System Memory - Buffers

panels.description: The number of kilobytes in the page cache.
panels.title: System Memory - Cached

panels.description: The number of kilobytes of physical memory in use

targets.expr: label_replace( sum(hardware_system_memory_mem_total_kilobytes{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"}) by (instance) - sum(hardware_system_memory_mem_free_kilobytes{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"}) by (instance) , "hostname", "$1", "instance", "(.*)")

panels.title: System Memory - Used

panels.description: The total amount of swap space in free and used, measured in kilobytes

targets.expr: label_replace( sum(hardware_system_memory_swap_total_kilobytes{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"}) by (instance) - sum(hardware_system_memory_swap_free_kilobytes{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"}) by (instance) , "hostname", "$1", "instance", "(.*)")

panels.title: System Memory - Swap

panels.description: An estimate of the number of kilobytes of system memory available for running new applications, without swapping
panels.title: System Memory - Available

panels.description: The percentage of time the CPU had something runnable, but the hypervisor chose to run something else. For servers with more than 1 CPU core, this value can exceed 100%.
panels.title: System cpu - steal

panels.description: The percentage of time the CPU spent servicing guest, which is included in user. For servers with more than 1 CPU core, this value can exceed 100%.
panels.title: System cpu - guest

panels.description: The percentage of time the CPU spent performing software interrupts. For servers with more than 1 CPU core, this value can exceed 100%.
panels.title: System cpu - softirq

panels.description: The percentage of time the CPU spent performing hardware interrupts. For servers with more than 1 CPU core, this value can exceed 100%.
panels.title: System cpu - irq

panels.description: The percentage of time the CPU spent waiting for IO operations to complete. For servers with more than 1 CPU core, this value can exceed 100%
panels.title: System cpu - iowait

panels.description: The percentage of time the CPU spent occupied by all processes with a positive nice value. For servers with more than 1 CPU core, this value can exceed 100%.
panels.title: System cpu - nice

panels.description: The percentage of time the CPU spent servicing operating system calls from all processes. For servers with more than 1 CPU core, this value can exceed 100%.
panels.title: System cpu - kernel

panels.description: The percentage of time the CPU spent servicing all user applications (not just MongoDB processes). For servers with more than 1 CPU core, this value can exceed 100%.
panels.title: System cpu - user

panels.description: The percentage of time the CPU spent servicing this MongoDB process, scaled to a range of 0-100% by dividing by the number of CPU cores.

targets.expr: label_replace((sum(rate(hardware_process_cpu_user_milliseconds{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*", process_port=~"$process_port" } [$interval])) by (instance, process_port)  / on(instance) group_left  hardware_platform_num_logical_cpus{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*" })/10, "hostname", "$1", "instance", "(.*)")

panels.title: Normalized Process cpu - user

targets.expr: label_replace((sum(rate(hardware_process_cpu_children_user_milliseconds{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*", process_port=~"$process_port" } [$interval])) by (instance, process_port)  / on(instance) group_left  hardware_platform_num_logical_cpus{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*" })/10, "hostname", "$1", "instance", "(.*)")

panels.description: The percentage of time the CPU spent servicing operating system calls for this MongoDB process, scaled to a range of 0-100% by dividing by the number of CPU cores.

targets.expr: label_replace((sum(rate(hardware_process_cpu_kernel_milliseconds{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*", process_port=~"$process_port" } [$interval])) by (instance, process_port)  / on(instance) group_left  hardware_platform_num_logical_cpus{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*" })/10, "hostname", "$1", "instance", "(.*)")

panels.title: Normalized Process cpu - kernel

targets.expr: label_replace((sum(rate(hardware_process_cpu_children_kernel_milliseconds{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*", process_port=~"$process_port" } [$interval])) by (instance, process_port)  / on(instance) group_left  hardware_platform_num_logical_cpus{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*" })/10, "hostname", "$1", "instance", "(.*)")

panels.description: The percentage of time the CPU spent servicing this MongoDB process. For servers with more than 1 CPU core, this value can exceed 100%.
panels.title: Process cpu - user

panels.description: The percentage of time the CPU spent servicing operating system calls for this MongoDB process. For servers with more than 1 CPU core, this value can exceed 100%.
panels.title: Process cpu - kernel

panels.description: The percentage of time the CPU had something runnable, but the hypervisor chose to run something else. It is scaled to a range of 0-100% by dividing by the number of CPU cores.

targets.expr: label_replace( sum(rate(hardware_system_cpu_steal_milliseconds{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"}[$interval]) / (10 * hardware_platform_num_logical_cpus{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"})) by (instance) , "hostname", "$1", "instance", "(.*)")

panels.title: Normalized System cpu - steal

panels.description: The percentage of time the CPU spent servicing guest, which is included in user. It is scaled to a range of 0-100% by dividing by the number of CPU cores.

targets.expr: label_replace( sum(rate(hardware_system_cpu_guest_milliseconds{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"}[$interval]) / (10 * hardware_platform_num_logical_cpus{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"})) by (instance) , "hostname", "$1", "instance", "(.*)")

panels.title: Normalized System cpu - guest

panels.description: The percentage of time the CPU spent performing software interrupts. It is scaled to a range of 0-100% by dividing by the number of CPU cores.

targets.expr: label_replace( sum(rate(hardware_system_cpu_soft_irq_milliseconds{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"}[$interval]) / (10 * hardware_platform_num_logical_cpus{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"})) by (instance) , "hostname", "$1", "instance", "(.*)")

panels.title: Normalized System cpu - softirq

panels.description: The percentage of time the CPU spent performing hardware interrupts. It is scaled to a range of 0-100% by dividing by the number of CPU cores.

targets.expr: label_replace( sum(rate(hardware_system_cpu_irq_milliseconds{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"}[$interval]) / (10 * hardware_platform_num_logical_cpus{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"})) by (instance) , "hostname", "$1", "instance", "(.*)")

panels.title: Normalized System cpu - irq

panels.description: The percentage of time the CPU spent waiting for IO operations to complete. It is scaled to a range of 0-100% by dividing by the number of CPU cores.
panels.title: Normalized System cpu - iowait

panels.description: The percentage of time the CPU spent occupied by all processes with a positive nice value. It is scaled to a range of 0-100% by dividing by the number of CPU cores.

targets.expr: label_replace( sum(rate(hardware_system_cpu_nice_milliseconds{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"}[$interval]) / (10 * hardware_platform_num_logical_cpus{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"})) by (instance) , "hostname", "$1", "instance", "(.*)")

panels.title: Normalized System cpu - nice

panels.description: The percentage of time the CPU spent servicing operating system calls from all processes. It is scaled to a range of 0-100% by dividing by the number of CPU cores.

targets.expr: label_replace( sum(rate(hardware_system_cpu_kernel_milliseconds{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"}[$interval]) / (10 * hardware_platform_num_logical_cpus{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"})) by (instance) , "hostname", "$1", "instance", "(.*)")

panels.title: Normalized System cpu - kernel

panels.description: The percentage of time the CPU spent servicing all user applications (not just MongoDB processes). It is scaled to a range of 0-100% by dividing by the number of CPU cores.

targets.expr: label_replace( sum(rate(hardware_system_cpu_user_milliseconds{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"}[$interval]) / (10 * hardware_platform_num_logical_cpus{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"})) by (instance) , "hostname", "$1", "instance", "(.*)")

panels.title: Normalized System cpu - user

panels.description: The average rate of physical bytes received per second by the eth0 network interface

targets.expr: label_replace( sum(rate(hardware_system_network_eth0_bytes_in_bytes{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"}[$interval])) by (instance) + sum(rate(hardware_system_network_lo_bytes_in_bytes{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"}[$interval])) by (instance), "hostname", "$1", "instance", "(.*)")

label_replace( -1 * sum(rate(hardware_system_network_eth0_bytes_out_bytes{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"}[$interval])) by (instance) + sum(rate(hardware_system_network_lo_bytes_out_bytes{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"}[$interval])) by (instance), "hostname", "$1", "instance", "(.*)")

panels.title: Network traffic

panels.description: The total bytes of free disk space on the disk partition used by MongoDB.
panels.title: System Disk - Free

panels.description: The percent of free disk space on the partition used by MongoDB.

targets.expr: label_replace( sum(hardware_disk_metrics_disk_space_free_bytes{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"} / (hardware_disk_metrics_disk_space_used_bytes{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"} + hardware_disk_metrics_disk_space_free_bytes{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"}) * 100) by (instance, disk_name) , "hostname", "$1", "instance", "(.*)")

panels.title: System Disk Percent Free

panels.description: The total bytes of used disk space on the partition that runs MongoDB.
panels.title: System Disk - Used

panels.description: The write throughput of I/O operations per second for the disk partition used for MongoDB.
panels.title: System Disk Write IOPS

panels.description: The write latency in milliseconds of the disk partition used by MongoDB.

targets.expr: label_replace( sum(rate(hardware_disk_metrics_write_time_milliseconds{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"}[$interval]) / rate(hardware_disk_metrics_write_count{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"}[$interval])) by (instance, disk_name), "hostname", "$1", "instance", "(.*)")

panels.title: System Disk Write Latency

panels.description: The Read latency in milliseconds of the disk partition used by MongoDB.

targets.expr: label_replace( sum(rate(hardware_disk_metrics_read_time_milliseconds{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"}[$interval]) / rate(hardware_disk_metrics_read_count{group_id=~"$group_id", cl_name=~"$cl_name", instance=~"$host.*"}[$interval])) by (instance, disk_name), "hostname", "$1", "instance", "(.*)")

panels.title: System Disk Read Latency

panels.description: The read throughput of I/O operations per second for the disk partition used for MongoDB.
panels.title: System Disk Read IOPS

panels.description: The percentage of time during which requests are being issued to and serviced by the partition. This includes requests from any process, not just MongoDB processes.
panels.title: System Disk Util %

panels.description: The average length of queue of requests issued to the disk partition used by MongoDB.
panels.title: System Disk Queue Depth

panels.description: The total number of pages swapped in and out per second
panels.title: System VM Swap IO

list.description: Only applicable for process level metrics
list.label: Process Port
list.name: process_port

title: MongoDB Atlas Hardware Metrics
description: MongoDB Atlas Hardware Metrics collected with official prometheus integration.
